A key contradiction in Marxist analysis as I understand it , are the potentialities that exist within capitalism that are left unrealized because the productive forces will be put to work only if there is to be a sufficient return on capital invested .

Thus we have the capital strike at present described by Harvey in which there is certainly the wealth available to finance unmet needs for jobs , medical care , education , and on and on but those needs are not met by the system and can not be when investors do not see expenditures in those areas as leading to an acceptable return on their investments .
